question.title: Matrix Block Sum
question.content:
Given a m x n matrix mat and an integer k, return a matrix answer where each answer[i][j] is the sum of all elements mat[r][c] for:

  • i - k <= r <= i + k,
  • j - k <= c <= j + k, and
  • (r, c) is a valid position in the matrix.

 

Example 1:

Input: mat = [[1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]], k = 1
Output: [[12,21,16],[27,45,33],[24,39,28]]

Example 2:

Input: mat = [[1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]], k = 2
Output: [[45,45,45],[45,45,45],[45,45,45]]

 

Constraints:

  • m == mat.length
  • n == mat[i].length
  • 1 <= m, n, k <= 100
  • 1 <= mat[i][j] <= 100

hints: How to calculate the required sum for a cell (i,j) fast ?
Use the concept of cumulative sum array.
Create a cumulative sum matrix where dp[i][j] is the sum of all cells in the rectangle from (0,0) to (i,j), use inclusion-exclusion idea.
